content.description: Sit start on the left side of the northeast arete. Utilizing side pulls and one giant pinch, move up the arete.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. Depending on who you are, it's tall.
content.location: There is a down-jump on the south side of the boulder. Reference map and pictures for exact locations.

content.description: This is a simple and direct problem on the far right side of the main face. Stand start on a giant flake (whose shape resembles a TIE Fighter's wing) and move to the top. It's a height dependent problem and the feet aren't great but it should be an easy send for most.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There is some sage growing just right of the landing so cover it or spot from that side.
content.location: There are several down climbs. Reference picture for route details.

content.description: On the northwest corner of the Empire Block is a short wave feature. Stem inside the wave (the crux) and move up. After you're on the block, the rest easy.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There's a rock right beside the problem so covering that up may be worthwhile. Or just have a good spotter.
content.location: This is on the northwest corner of the Empire Block. There is a spot to jump down on the south face and a down climb on the northeast face.

content.description: Start in the middle of the main face, just right of It's Getting Hoth in Here. Using crimps and some delicate footwork, move up the slab face.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing is stellar.
content.location: There is a down climb/jump off the back side of the boulder or you can down climb the primary face's left side.

content.description: Start on two crimps in the middle of the north face and move up delicately using crimps to the top.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter but the landing is great.
content.location: This is located on the center of the north face. Down climb is the south side jump or the literal down climb on the northeast corner of the north face.

content.description:
Stand start with high hands in a "V" (see picture for exact details). From there, traverse slight right and dyne to the next point. After the dyne, traverse right again and top out. The feet are terrible but the hands are good.

NOTE: There are multiple ways of doing this problem and the grade only reflects my experience.
content.location: See picture for exact information. There are several options off the block by down climbing or jumping off the lower points.

content.description: Squat start on a protruding triangle with hands matched and a great foot ledge. Move to the next ledge with the hands and make a more dynamic more (figuring out the toe beta that works for you) to a sloper. Either bump or cross to reach the positive holds and top out.
content.location: This climbs up the left arete of the northwest face. The down climb is on the north east corner or there is a jump down on the south face.

content.description: Sit start on the left side of the north face and move upward, utilizing big holds and positive feet. The crux is the start and it eases up after the beginning.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter but the landing is great.
content.location: This is located on the left side of the northeast face. The down climb is either on the south side to jump off or down climb where you climbed up and hop off.

climbs.name: Dear Luke, I Like it When You Call Me Big Papa, Love Dad.

content.description: Start on the right side of the southeast face (right of Cloud City Skyline) and move up the arete on delicate smears and sloper holds.
content.protection: Pads and spotters and good mental fortitude.
content.location: View pictures for more exact location. There are several down climb and down jump ways off the boulder.

content.description: Start on the east slab. Using good holds and big moves, climb to the top.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. This problem may be considered tall for some.
content.location: Down-jump is located on the south face. Reference pics and mad for exact locations.

content.description: Sit start on the right side of the in-cut "amphitheater" (right of Wampa Showdown) and move up the arete.
content.location: See picture for accurate beta. There are down climbs and down jumps in multiple locations on the boulder.
